Trust me, I hate everything but I love this: a curmudgeon’s best Bay Area food list

The Chronicle's senior editor of food and wine, Serena Dai, has gained the reputation on staff for being the hardest to please when it comes to food. So in this edition of Bite Curious, she takes over from critic Soleil Ho to talk about some of the things she actually loved this year — from a specific date variety to a must-get salsa macha.
How ‘free state’ California wrote slavery and white supremacy into its law books

A series of state Supreme Court rulings from the 1850s supporting slaveholders and the racial climate from which they arose are now the subject of a state task force tasked with examining the history of slavery in California and considering reparations for African Americans, particularly those whose ancestors were slaves.
After four years of smoke and fires, Bay Area wineries rejoice in a ‘normal’ harvest

As this year’s fire season approached, Bay Area wineries braced for the worst. But for the first time in years, there were no major wildfires in Wine Country. It has given new hope to weary vintners who had feared their industry might be doomed.
